arts.ttl: Smith Rowe stars as Fulham beat Crystal Palace
arts.sum: Palace had failed to win any of their nine previous Premier League games when conceding first, and they struggled to create chances for an equaliser after the break. Fresh from their best start to a Premier League season in 21 years – 15 points from ten games – Silva’s side looked confident and threatening every time they went forward.

arts.ttl: Fulham 2-0 C Palace (9 de Nov., 2024) Resultado Final

arts.ttl: Silva hails Wilson after Fulham win
arts.sum: Fulham reaction. The post Silva hails Wilson after Fulham win appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Fulham boss Silva on ‘top talent’ Smith Rowe and Alex Iwobi being star performer this campaign
arts.sum: Silva is demanding more from all of his players despite a strong start to the campaign for Fulham, who followed up a dramatic derby win at home to Brentford with maximum points in SE25. “For me, last season was the best season from him in the Premier League,” said Fulham head coach Silva, who was instrumental in pushing to be reunited with the attacking midfielder when he joined from Everton.

arts.ttl: Fulham boss Marco Silva: Harry Wilson doing nothing wrong in bid to start games
arts.sum: Wilson scored a second-half stoppage-time brace on Monday night to beat Brentford and netted again from the bench in the win at Palace on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Premier League roundup: Fulham into top six, Wolves earn first win, West Ham struggle
arts.sum: There were four Premier League kick-offs at 3pm, with Fulham, Brentford and West Ham among the teams in action.

arts.ttl: Fulham boss Silva happy with 'great team performance'
arts.sum: Fulham manager Marco Silva praises his team's "mature performance" after their 2-0 win at Crystal Palace to move to sixth in the Premier League table.
Oliver Glasner has given his verdict on Saturday’s loss to Fulham at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Palace made too many mistakes - Glasner
arts.sum: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner believes Fulham were "the better team" and deserved their 2-0 victory at Selhurst Park and his Palace side made "too many mistakes".

arts.ttl: Harry Wilson stars from bench again as Fulham beat 10-man Crystal Palace
arts.sum: Emile Smith Rowe, born in nearby Thornton Heath, opened the scoring two minutes into first-half stoppage time.
